image.altText: daughter holding photo

props.synopsis: Sonja Kurtzer was a "trailblazing feminist" who inevitably lost her identity in an attempt to seek "spiritual healing". Now, her daughter Ellen Bertani is on a quest for justice.

title.children: Ellen's mum sought 'spiritual healing', then stopped counselling and medication

image.altText: An ancient axe next to a ruler

props.synopsis: A South Australian teacher who collected hundreds of objects starting in the 1960s is now trying to sell them, but Indigenous leaders say they should instead be put on display in a "keeping place" that doesn't yet exist.

title.children: Sale of large collection of South Australian Aboriginal artefacts opposed

image.altText: A man with light brown hair wearing a blue shirt

props.synopsis: A "predatory" photographer who committed child sex offences has been slammed by his victims in court and labelled a "monster" who ruined their lives. Warning: This story contains details readers may find confronting.

title.children: Adelaide photographer who sexually abused kids labelled 'monster' in court

image.altText: A sheep loading ramp is shown balancing precariously on a tin drum on its side behind a stock truck.

props.synopsis: The Crap Loading Ramps of Australia Facebook page attracts lots of attention online, but the founder says its tongue-in-cheek posts highlight a serious issue in the livestock industry.

title.children: Truckies fed up with 'major' safety issue get creative to highlight danger

image.altText: Jacob and Helen smile at the camera while Helen puts her arm around her son

props.synopsis: A specialised dental service is helping to fill a big cavity in an industry that has been largely inaccessible for people with disability. For Jacob, 20, it has been life changing.

title.children: For people living with disability, accessing a dentist can be a challenge

image.altText: The sign outside the South Australian Coroners Court.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Supreme Court has quashed a certificate giving a former SA Health employee immunity during an inquest into three ramping deaths.

title.children: Doctor loses immunity over ramping inquest evidence

image.altText: An orange wave buoy rider in the ocean

props.synopsis: The wave buoy off the coast of Kangaroo Island provides critical data for fishers, commercial divers, shipping companies and surfers but it has been deactivated since September, prompting questions about its fate.

title.children: Broken wave buoy leaves fishers and divers without critical information for months

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A woman who disguised herself as someone living with a disability and used a solution which had "a smell of chilli about it" and a homemade taser to steal jewellery was trying clear debts owed to a drug syndicate, a court has heard.

title.children: Woman who sprayed shopkeeper's face with suspected chilli solution faces court

image.altText: A close-up of the blades of a windmill, standing over a dirt path and some lakes.

props.synopsis: Millions of tonnes of soil and rock from the Torrens to Darlington tunnel project will be processed at a site in Adelaide's north, despite concerns about the potential contamination risk to nearby wetlands.

title.children: Environmentalists raise concerns Gillman proposal will put wetlands at risk

image.altText: A small square robot has four white wheels, it wheels through white sand

props.synopsis: A Queensland-based consortium will design, build and operate the Australian first Moon rover, which is set to launch later this decade.

title.children: Builder chosen for Roo-ver, the little robot who will head to the Moon

image.altText: A close up on a two-month-old baby's face, with its right hand on its cheek.

props.synopsis: The family of a baby injured in a shocking home invasion in Alice Springs thanks the community for its support after a fundraiser drew more than $52,000 in donations.

title.children: $52,000 raised for baby injured in Alice Springs home invasion

image.altText: fire through the bushland overhead shot

props.synopsis: Properties have come under threat near Victoria's Grampians National Park after a bushfire ripped through more than 5,000 hectares of land in just 24 hours.

title.children: Fire in Victoria's Grampians grows 10 times bigger in a day

image.altText: Sally Catherall sitting on a bench, surrounded by dogs.

props.synopsis: The ABC speaks to those who took alternative and complementary medicines after a cancer diagnosis and how they navigated their beliefs.

title.children: Cancer patient told she wasn't 'positive enough' when turmeric didn't work

image.altText: Floodwaters block off a regional road.

props.synopsis: An emergency alert was issued earlier this morning for Jandowae Creek in the Western Downs, with residents in low-lying areas urged to leave.

title.children: Teenage boy swept into stormwater drain as heavy rain lashes Queensland

image.altText: A man in a green long-coat stands next to a woman in a long grey coat alongside a wall with pictures of people on it

props.synopsis: Australia will reopen its embassy in Ukraine's war-torn capital Kyiv, with Penny Wong making the announcement on the first visit to Kyiv by an Australian foreign minister since Russia's full-scale invasion in 2022.

title.children: Australia to reopen embassy in Ukraine almost three years after closure

image.altText: A close-up of Jim Chalmers's face.

props.synopsis: The government's mid-year budget update is bereft of even the slightest whiff of pre-election razzamatazz — which makes it rather strange by the standards of budget politics.

title.children: Chalmers wants you to immediately forget this budget update ever happened

image.altText: Covers lie on the wicket as rain comes down at a cricket ground

props.synopsis: The opening match of the three-match ODI series between Australia and New Zealand has been abandoned without a ball being bowled.

title.children: Relentless rain in Wellington leads to Rose Bowl opener being abandoned

image.altText: John in a library

props.synopsis: Acclaimed children's author John Marsden raised generations of children through his bestselling books and the schools he founded.

title.children: John Marsden had no biological children but raised generations of kids

image.altText: Child holding hand

props.synopsis: Children with disability are frequently misunderstood by responders, slip through the cracks of multiple service providers and can at times be used as weapons, parents and advocates say.

title.children: NDIS plans of children with disability weaponised by abusive parents

image.altText: The bomb blast scene in Kuta several days after the bomb blasts.

props.synopsis: Australia asks Malaysia for assurances that two men who admitted conspiring in the Bali bombings are being closely monitored following their repatriation from Guantanamo Bay.

title.children: 'Terrorists shouldn't get deals': Bali bomb duo's transfer sparks anger

image.altText: Pina colada

props.synopsis: A toxicology report into the suspected alcohol poisonings at Fiji's Warwick Resort that left four Australians critically ill has found no traces of methanol.

title.children: 'No methanol' found in Fiji alcohol poisoning that hospitalised Australians

image.altText: A silver four-wheel-drive vehicle with its front end squashed under a collapsed building roof with debris scattered around

props.synopsis: Vanuatu's tourism businesses say visitors will play a major role in its post-earthquake recovery, when the country is ready for them.

title.children: Vanuatu's tourism operators assess damage after earthquake

image.altText: two women sitting at a table looking through documents

props.synopsis: It's been a long and exhausting journey, and even a legally-binding order made by a civil tribunal may not have brought their fight to an end.

title.children: 'We just want to have long service leave': Workers' long fight for entitlements

image.altText: A young man in a grey button-up shirt and black pants sits in a wheelchair with his hands ion the wheels.

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old Sydney man says he was told his wheelchair posed a risk to patrons and was made to leave the dancefloor on a night out at the 3 Wise Monkeys pub with his mates.

title.children: Man kicked off Sydney pub's dancefloor because of wheelchair

image.altText: Woman vlogging at home with Christmas tree behind.

props.synopsis: A relatively new type of advertising is seeing "explosive growth" due to converging trends in consumer behaviour, with industry experts saying this Christmas will be the biggest ever for affiliate marketers.

title.children: Hidden commissions behind this year's Christmas gift guide boom

image.altText: Twenty small ziplock backs containing different shaped and coloured pills and powders.

props.synopsis: NSW will begin a pill testing trial at music festivals from early 2025 in what it says will help combat the risks and harms associated with using illicit drugs.

title.children: NSW to begin pill testing trial at music festivals from early 2025

image.altText: Three large metal structures in a paddock with cows.

props.synopsis: The federal government has green-lit a southern NSW project that will form a key part of its plan to connect more renewable energy to the grid.

title.children: Controversial $4.8b Snowy 2.0 transmission project gets federal approval

image.altText: Optus signs outside a shop in Brisbane on May 15 2012.

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog alleges that the telco giant engaged in unconscionable conduct in its Mount Isa store by creating fraudulent contracts for 42 vulnerable customers and racking up $150,000 of debt.

title.children: ACCC accuses Optus store of pushing customers into $150k debts

image.altText: Penny Wong during a media conference.

props.synopsis: Israeli media is reporting the country's Foreign Minister, Gideon Sa'ar, blasted Penny Wong during a phone call on Tuesday, accusing Australia of abandoning Israel in its most difficult year.

title.children: Penny Wong plays down 'heated' call with Israeli counterpart

image.altText: Destruction from Cyclone Tracy on Daly St

props.synopsis: Cyclone Tracy and its total destruction of Darwin prompted a national overhaul of the National Construction Code. But some building industry experts argue it doesn't provide enough protection.

title.children: Experts warn building codes still fall short following Cyclone Tracy

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue spacesuits pose for a photo, smiling.

props.synopsis: The delay means what should have been an eight-day stay on the International Space Station for Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore will now be at least nine months.

title.children: Return of NASA astronauts from ISS further delayed until late March

image.altText: Pat Cummins stands with his hands on his hips

props.synopsis: Australia's Test captain Pat Cummins has rejected claims from former coach Darren Lehmann that chief selector George Bailey is too close to players.

title.children: Pat Cummins defends Test selectors after Darren Lehmann's criticism

image.altText: A Queensland police officer operating a roadside speed camera

props.synopsis: From Friday, double demerit points will be applied by a number of states around the country. But in many other jurisdictions, it will be business as usual.

title.children: Drivers in some states can get double demerit points over summer break

image.altText: Close up of a white chihuahua's face in focus, with a blurred vet injecting a vaccine in background

props.synopsis: Vets are urging pet owners to vaccinate their dogs against the deadly parvovirus, as cases in unvaccinated dogs rise in one regional Victorian community.

title.children: Pet vaccine misinformation rising following COVID-19 pandemic, vets say
